CSS_propertyInitial-value.summary: The initial-value CSS descriptor is required when using the @property at-rule unless the syntax accepts any valid token stream. It sets the initial-value for the property.

remarks.para: The value chosen as the initial-value must parse correctly according to the syntax definition. Therefore, if syntax is <color> then the initial-value must be a valid color value.

-CSS Properties and Values API
-CSS Painting API
-CSS Typed Object Model
-CSS Houdini

CSS_propertyInitial-value.value: A string with a value which is a correct value for the chosen syntax.
